channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Neural Message Passing for Visual Relationship Detection
item.description: Visual relationship detection aims to detect the interactions between objects in an image; however, this task suffers from combinatorial explosion due to the variety of objects and interactions.

item.title: GRIT-VLP: Grouped Mini-batch Sampling for Efficient Vision and Language Pre-training
item.description: In contrast to the mainstream VLP methods, we highlight that two routinely applied steps during pre-training have crucial impact on the performance of the pre-trained model: in-batch hard negative sampling for image-text matching (ITM) and assigning the large masking probability for the masked language modeling (MLM).

item.title: Depth Quality-Inspired Feature Manipulation for Efficient RGB-D and Video Salient Object Detection
item.description: Inspired by the fact that depth quality is a key factor influencing the accuracy, we propose an efficient depth quality-inspired feature manipulation (DQFM) process, which can dynamically filter depth features according to depth quality.

item.title: Generalizable Medical Image Segmentation via Random Amplitude Mixup and Domain-Specific Image Restoration
item.description: We demonstrate the performance of our method on two public generalizable segmentation benchmarks in medical images, which validates our method could achieve the state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Abstractive Meeting Summarization: A Survey
item.description: Recent advances in deep learning, and especially the invention of encoder-decoder architectures, has significantly improved the performance of abstractive summarization systems.

item.title: NPB-REC: Non-parametric Assessment of Uncertainty in Deep-learning-based MRI Reconstruction from Undersampled Data
item.description: We demonstrated the added-value of our approach on the multi-coil brain MRI dataset, from the fastmri challenge, in comparison to the baseline E2E-VarNet with and without inference-time dropout.

item.title: Advancing Plain Vision Transformer Towards Remote Sensing Foundation Model
item.description: In this paper, we resort to plain vision transformers with about 100 million parameters and make the first attempt to propose large vision models customized for RS tasks and explore how such large models perform.

item.title: Contrastive Learning with Bidirectional Transformers for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Contrastive learning with Transformer-based sequence encoder has gained predominance for sequential recommendation.

item.title: Dataset of Industrial Metal Objects
item.description: The close correspondence between synthetic and real-world data, and controlled variations, will facilitate sim-to-real research.

item.title: Label-Free Synthetic Pretraining of Object Detectors
item.description: Our "SOLID" approach consists of two main components: (1) generating synthetic images using a collection of unlabelled 3D models with optimized scene arrangement; (2) pretraining an object detector on "instance detection" task - given a query image depicting an object, detecting all instances of the exact same object in a target image.

item.title: UFNRec: Utilizing False Negative Samples for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: To this end, we propose a novel method that can Utilize False Negative samples for sequential Recommendation (UFNRec) to improve model performance.

item.title: CheXRelNet: An Anatomy-Aware Model for Tracking Longitudinal Relationships between Chest X-Rays
item.description: Despite the progress in utilizing deep learning to automate chest radiograph interpretation and disease diagnosis tasks, change between sequential Chest X-rays (CXRs) has received limited attention.

item.title: Learning Diverse Document Representations with Deep Query Interactions for Dense Retrieval
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new dense retrieval model which learns diverse document representations with deep query interactions.

item.title: Is this Change the Answer to that Problem? Correlating Descriptions of Bug and Code Changes for Evaluating Patch Correctness
item.description: To tackle this problem, our intuition is that natural language processing can provide the necessary representations and models for assessing the semantic correlation between a bug (question) and a patch (answer).

item.title: SKDCGN: Source-free Knowledge Distillation of Counterfactual Generative Networks using cGANs
item.description: Moreover, as an additional contribution, our paper conducts a thorough study on the composition mechanism of the CGNs, to gain a better understanding of how each mechanism influences the classification accuracy of an invariant classifier.

item.title: No More Strided Convolutions or Pooling: A New CNN Building Block for Low-Resolution Images and Small Objects
item.description: Convolutional neural networks (CNNs) have made resounding success in many computer vision tasks such as image classification and object detection.

item.title: Graph R-CNN: Towards Accurate 3D Object Detection with Semantic-Decorated Local Graph
item.description: The dynamic farthest voxel sampling is then applied to evenly sample the points.

item.title: When can I Speak? Predicting initiation points for spoken dialogue agents
item.description: Current spoken dialogue systems initiate their turns after a long period of silence (700-1000ms), which leads to little real-time feedback, sluggish responses, and an overall stilted conversational flow.

item.title: Fine-Grained Egocentric Hand-Object Segmentation: Dataset, Model, and Applications
item.description: Egocentric videos offer fine-grained information for high-fidelity modeling of human behaviors.

item.title: Socially Intelligent Genetic Agents for the Emergence of Explicit Norms
item.description: Norms help regulate a society.

item.title: Preserving Fine-Grain Feature Information in Classification via Entropic Regularization
item.description: In this paper we are interested in the problem of solving fine-grain classification or regression, using a model trained on coarse-grain labels only.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Online Action Detection for Infant General Movements
item.description: Although general movements assessment(GMA) has shown promising results in early CP detection, it is laborious.

item.title: Accelerating Numerical Solvers for Large-Scale Simulation of Dynamical System via NeurVec
item.description: Conventional numerical solvers used in the simulation are significantly limited by the step size for time integration, which hampers efficiency and feasibility especially when high accuracy is desired.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Quantum Technologies
item.description: In recent years, the dramatic progress in machine learning has begun to impact many areas of science and technology significantly.

item.title: Towards Graph Representation Learning Based Surgical Workflow Anticipation
item.description: Hence, we propose a graph representation learning framework to comprehensively represent instrument motions in the surgical workflow anticipation problem.

item.title: Domain Randomization-Enhanced Depth Simulation and Restoration for Perceiving and Grasping Specular and Transparent Objects
item.description: Commercial depth sensors usually generate noisy and missing depths, especially on specular and transparent objects, which poses critical issues to downstream depth or point cloud-based tasks.

item.title: An Adaptive and Altruistic PSO-based Deep Feature Selection Method for Pneumonia Detection from Chest X-Rays
item.description: The proposed method successfully eliminates non-informative features obtained from the ResNet50 model, thereby improving the Pneumonia detection ability of the overall framework.

item.title: Oversquashing in GNNs through the lens of information contraction and graph expansion
item.description: We compare the spectral expansion properties of our algorithm with that of an existing curvature-based non-local rewiring strategy.

item.title: Class Is Invariant to Context and Vice Versa: On Learning Invariance for Out-Of-Distribution Generalization
item.description: If the context in every class is evenly distributed, OOD would be trivial because the context can be easily removed due to an underlying principle: class is invariant to context.

item.title: Follow Me: Conversation Planning for Target-driven Recommendation Dialogue Systems
item.description: Recommendation dialogue systems aim to build social bonds with users and provide high-quality recommendations.

item.title: Deep Learning-enabled Spatial Phase Unwrapping for 3D Measurement
item.description: This system necessitates a robust spatial phase unwrapping (SPU) algorithm.

item.title: Frozen CLIP Models are Efficient Video Learners
item.description: Video recognition has been dominated by the end-to-end learning paradigm -- first initializing a video recognition model with weights of a pretrained image model and then conducting end-to-end training on videos.

item.title: MonoViT: Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation with a Vision Transformer
item.description: Self-supervised monocular depth estimation is an attractive solution that does not require hard-to-source depth labels for training.

item.title: BrainFormer: A Hybrid CNN-Transformer Model for Brain fMRI Data Classification
item.description: In neuroimaging analysis, functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) can well assess brain function changes for brain diseases with no obvious structural lesions.

item.title: BlenderBot 3: a deployed conversational agent that continually learns to responsibly engage
item.description: We present BlenderBot 3, a 175B parameter dialogue model capable of open-domain conversation with access to the internet and a long-term memory, and having been trained on a large number of user defined tasks.

item.title: Perception-Distortion Balanced ADMM Optimization for Single-Image Super-Resolution
item.description: In image super-resolution, both pixel-wise accuracy and perceptual fidelity are desirable.

item.title: A Gaze into the Internal Logic of Graph Neural Networks, with Logic
item.description: The problem is known as graph node property prediction and our approach will consist in emulating with help of a Prolog program the key information propagation steps of a Graph Neural Network's training and inference stages.

item.title: TransMatting: Enhancing Transparent Objects Matting with Transformers
item.description: Image matting refers to predicting the alpha values of unknown foreground areas from natural images.

item.title: Sinusoidal Sensitivity Calculation for Line Segment Geometries
item.description: Purpose: Provide a closed-form solution to the sinusoidal coil sensitivity model proposed by Kern et al.

item.title: Towards No.1 in CLUE Semantic Matching Challenge: Pre-trained Language Model Erlangshen with Propensity-Corrected Loss
item.description: This report describes a pre-trained language model Erlangshen with propensity-corrected loss, the No. 1 in CLUE Semantic Matching Challenge.

item.title: Adversarial Robustness of MR Image Reconstruction under Realistic Perturbations
item.description: Deep Learning (DL) methods have shown promising results for solving ill-posed inverse problems such as MR image reconstruction from undersampled $k$-space data.

item.title: Bayesian predictive modeling of multi-source multi-way data
item.description: We develop a Bayesian approach to predict a continuous or binary outcome from data that are collected from multiple sources with a multi-way (i. e.. multidimensional tensor) structure.

item.title: Localized Sparse Incomplete Multi-view Clustering
item.description: Moreover, a novel local graph embedding term is introduced to learn the structured consensus representation.

item.title: Rethinking Degradation: Radiograph Super-Resolution via AID-SRGAN
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first composite degradation model proposed for radiographic images.

item.title: COPER: Continuous Patient State Perceiver
item.description: COPER uses Perceiver model and the concept of neural ordinary differential equations (ODEs) to learn the continuous time dynamics of patient state, i. e., continuity of input space and continuity of output space.

item.title: BoxShrink: From Bounding Boxes to Segmentation Masks
item.description: One of the core challenges facing the medical image computing community is fast and efficient data sample labeling.

item.title: Seamless Iterative Semi-Supervised Correction of Imperfect Labels in Microscopy Images
item.description: We propose Seamless Iterative Semi-Supervised correction of Imperfect labels (SISSI), a new method for training object detection models with noisy and missing annotations in a semi-supervised fashion.

item.title: ChiQA: A Large Scale Image-based Real-World Question Answering Dataset for Multi-Modal Understanding
item.description: However, in most of the public visual question answering datasets such as VQA, CLEVR, the questions are human generated that specific to the given image, such as `What color are her eyes?'.

item.title: A Cooperation Graph Approach for Multiagent Sparse Reward Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Next, based on this novel graph structure, we propose a Cooperation Graph Multiagent Reinforcement Learning (CG-MARL) algorithm, which can efficiently deal with the sparse reward problem in multiagent tasks.

item.title: Real-time Gesture Animation Generation from Speech for Virtual Human Interaction
item.description: We propose a real-time system for synthesizing gestures directly from speech.
